column2: These radio-probes, because of their short half-lives, must be produced as needed in a lead-shielded hot cell with remotely controlled and automated equipment that is capable of synthesizing the radio-probe, purification and formulation of the radiopharmaceutical preparation for intravenous injection, all within only two to three half-lives of the radioisotope. The hydrophilic interaction chromatography procedure utilizing a semi-preparative silica column and high volatile organic mobile phase led to excellent separation of the target Positron emission tomography probe from chemical/radiochemical impurities within a very short run time of purification and formulation for intravenous injection. Acknowledgement  The authors thank the staff at the National Institute of Radiological Sciences for their excellent assistance in the production of the various radiopharmaceuticals.
